nodes.title: Article S2
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the statutes of the Zaire Federation of Sports Medicine. It covers the federation's establishment, its direct oversight by the national sports authority, and its core objectives: developing national sport through medical control, coordinating domestic sports studies, and fostering international relations. It specifies the headquarters in Kinshasa and details the federation's functions, including establishing medical-sport structures, standardizing examination methods, forming technical commissions, implementing sports medicine programs (covering regulation, equipment, education, and training), and managing international information exchange. The document also states that the federation's duration is unlimited.

nodes.title: Article S4
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the governing structure of a sports federation. It details the composition, meeting procedures, and powers of two main bodies: the General Assembly and the Executive Committee (Comité directeur). It specifies the roles and responsibilities of the Executive Committee's officers, including the President, Vice-President, Secretary General, and Deputy Secretary General/Treasurer. The text establishes that the federation operates under the oversight of the State Commissioner for Sports.

nodes.title: Article S7
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the membership structure of a federation. It defines two main categories: full members (medical-sports centers across the Republic) and individual members. It further details three types of individual membership: for those who have provided eminent service, benefactors who have given material support, and honorary members whose affiliation enhances the federation's prestige.

nodes.title: Article S9
nodes.summary: The partial document outlines the various sources of funding and resources for the Zaire Federation of Sports Medicine, including voluntary member contributions, state subsidies, grants from sports organizations, donations, revenue from publications and services, and exceptional fundraising activities.
